Name: Yapese
comm_Source: Müller (1917:125f.): similar, but one power less

Name: Nguluwan
comm_Source: Eilers' list of numerals ends at 600

Name: Nukuoro
comm_Source: Carroll & Soulik (1973): same numerals (except for 10) up to 10^8

Name: Marshallese
comm_Source: for power numerals in specific counting systems, see Erdland (1906:204f.); analysis in Bender & Beller (subm.)

Name: Pingelapese
comm_Source: Eilers (1934:461-463) reports similar, yet more complicated numerals (except for 10) up to 10^9

Name: Mokilese
comm_Source: Eilers (1934:397) reports similar, yet more complicated numerals (except for 10), and up to 10^3 only

Name: Namonuito
comm_Source: Quackenbush (1968:201-203) reports a pattern in line with Trukic (with 10^3 = ngaraj)

Name: Woleaian
comm_Source: unclear whether Krämer's (1937) power numerals for 10^5 onwards apply also to Lamotrek, or only to Fais

Name: Woleaian
comm_Source: for power numerals in specific counting systems, see Sohn & Tawerilmang (1976:255,394); analysis in Bender & Beller (subm.)

Name: Woleaian
comm_Source: for power numerals in specific counting systems, see Alkire (1970:10-13); analysis in Bender & Beller (subm.)

Name: Sonsorol
comm_Source: for power numerals in pair-wise counting, see Eilers (1935:380); analysis in Bender & Beller (subm.)

Name: Tobian
comm_Source: Eilers also renders numerals reported by Pickering, Hale, and  Hellwig
